Switching My Website Over From Jekyll to 11ty

March 20, 2025

Today I made the decisions of moving my website over from Jekyll to 11ty. The move started because I ran into a problem that I had never encountered with using Jekyll.

Learning Jekyll Forced Me To Become A Better Website Developer

I've been using Jekyll for a while now and learning it was one of the best decisions I made. Jekyll was the first static site generator I learned how to use mainly because I wanted to host my website for free on Github. I'll always appreciate Jekyll because through the process of learning this software I also learned all the little details that requires creating and deploying a website from the bottom up Before learning Jekyll I relied on various types of templating software like WordPress themes to build out my web projects, while these technologies are great they don't offer the level of customization that I was looking for.

What Happened That Made Me Switch

I didn't really plan on learning how to use a new static site generator but the longer my Jekyll site was taking to load after making some edits the more I began to consider finding alternative options. I finally decided to make the move when my laptop froze for almost an entire minute. At first I thought it was my hardware because the laptop I was using at that moment was a little older, but after running some tests on my higher performing PC's a little later I realized it wasn't a problem with my laptop at all It was the software I was using and what I was expecting from it. Up until now I had been using Jekyll for smaller websites that focused more on design or very text heavy SEO projects which is why I never ran into performance issues. Now that I'm creating larger projects with more code and assets I've quickly hit it's limitations.

Jekyll Is For Smaller Website Projects

Through some research I learned that longer build times are a very common problem when it comes to Jekyll projects especially when it comes to Jekyll projects with a lot of content. I even read about a person who's site had around 100 pages and their build time was about a half an hour. Theirs a lot of well informed opinions on the web design forums indicating that the reason Jekyll builds take a long time is because Ruby on Rails, the main language used to write Jekyll, is outdated or that file configuration plays a big role but I couldn't really tell you anything for sure. What I can tell you is that the way Jekyll is built makes it a fast and reliable solutions for website developer and designer even to this day.

Choosing A New Static Site Generator

My search for a new static site generator started during one of the Jekyll builds when I was just sitting there frozen.The more I looked into alternatives the more overwhelmed I became until I found something that I was very familiar with 11ty.

What is 11ty?

11ty is a static site

Why I Chose 11ty As My New Static Site Generator

Theirs a countless options to deploy a website.

From what I've read online it seems that Jekyll is built using older technology. Compare that to 11ty that's built with JavaScript and builds website almost instantaneously.

Transisitionsnig Static Site Generators

One of the reasons I had not considered learning a new static site generators was because I thought It was going to take me a long time to learn how to use software and all the little nuances that come with it..
